metadata.Title: CVE-2012-1663 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in libgnutls in GnuTLS before 3.0.14 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted certificate list.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1663` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgnutls-openssl27 - 2.12.14-5ubuntu2
libgnutls26 - 2.12.14-5ubuntu2
libgnutlsxx27 - 2.12.14-5ubuntu2
No subscription required

gnutls-bin - 2.12.14-5ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> The vulnerable code was introduced in gnutls-2.99.1

criterions.comment: gnutls26 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.12.14-5ubuntu2').
gnutls26 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.12.14-5ubuntu2').
